intro: Gazania beguinotii, commonly known as the Cape goldflame, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow petals and a central brown disk. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. It is drought-tolerant and prefers well-drained soil, which makes it adaptable to various climates. Gazania beguinotii is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
